page.title: 17LAW AND ORDER IN NORTHWOLD
page.content: A team of 3 Constables,one of whom is resident in Northwold,police a group of 8 villages,including Northwold, patrolling in a car in radio contact with Norfolk Constabulary Headquarters at Norwich. The main law and order problems are road traffic offences,petty crime and burglaries.However the constable can and will be called upon to deal with any aspect of police work that will arise from time to time.The most swiftly growing menace to society in 1985 is drug abuse,which has not escaped Northwold entirely.The problem is that the people involved resort to crime in order to finance their ever growing dependence on drugs. Offenders usually appear before Thetford Magistrates Court,and are tried by Justices of the Peace,unless the case warrents a hearing at a higher court.
